page.title: 07A STORM AND FLOODING IN 1981
page.content: On December 13th 1981 there was a high tide and gale force winds. The sea swept over the sea wall and into nearby houses. On the morning of the 14th many people in Kewstoke and Sand Bay were flooded.There was no entry to the flooded area but from the Toll Road you could see empty dinghies floating around, sandbags by doors, pebbles on wet roads and ruined gardens. The sea had come half a mile inland. In some houses the water was a foot deep.One old lady even had a cow in her living room which came from a nearby farm.
